definitions.definition: for ) To officially charge someone in a court of law .
examples: He was arraigned in Washington, D.C., on the 25th of that month on charges of treason.

definitions.definition: To call to account , or accuse, before the bar of reason, taste, or any other tribunal .

main_definition: ( with on , ( archaic ) for ) To officially charge someone in a court of law .
secondary_definitions: To call to account , or accuse, before the bar of reason, taste, or any other tribunal .
